abstract_summ: A preliminary observation of high frequency of male pattern hair loss among admitted COVID-19 patients, and suggest that androgen expression might be a clue to COVID-19 severity.We report the clinical features of 3 patients in France who had parotitis (inflammation of the parotid salivary glands) as a clinical manifestation of confirmed coronavirus disease.We report a 56-year-old man with confirmed COVID-19 infection who presented with a probable atypical skin manifestation of this disease mimicking arthropod bite reaction.In a not negligible number of patients affected by COVID‐19 (coronavirus disease 2019), especially if paucisymptomatic, anosmia and ageusia can represent the first or only symptomatology present.Results from magnetic resonance imaging support the occurrence of intraparotid lymphadenitis, leading to a parotitis-like clinical picture.
title_summ: Parotitis-Like Symptoms Associated with COVID-19, France, March-April 2020.A preliminary observation: male pattern hair loss among hospitalized COVID-19 patients in Spain - A potential clue to the role of androgens in COVID-19 severity.A probable atypical skin manifestation of COVID-19 infection.Anosmia and Ageusia: Common Findings in COVID‐19 Patients
